atomic_tests.name: Process Hollowing using PowerShell
atomic_tests.description:
This test uses PowerShell to create a Hollow from a PE on disk with explorer as the parent.
Credit to FuzzySecurity (https://github.com/FuzzySecurity/PowerShell-Suite/blob/master/Start-Hollow.ps1)

hollow_binary_path.description: Path of the binary to hollow (executable that will run inside the sponsor)

sponsor_binary_path.description: Path of the sponsor binary (executable that will host the binary)

spawnto_process_name.description: Name of the process to spawn

atomic_tests.name: RunPE via VBA
atomic_tests.description: This module executes notepad.exe from within the WINWORD.EXE process

dependencies.get_prereq_command: Write-Host "You will need to install Microsoft #{ms_product} manually to meet this requirement"

atomic_tests.name: Process Hollowing in Go using CreateProcessW WinAPI
atomic_tests.description:
Creates a process in a suspended state, executes shellcode to spawn calc.exe in a child process, and then resumes the original process.
- PoC Credit: (https://github.com/Ne0nd0g/go-shellcode#createprocess)

hollow_binary_path.description: Path of the binary to hollow

hollow_process_name.description: Name of the process to hollow

atomic_tests.name: Process Hollowing in Go using CreateProcessW and CreatePipe WinAPIs (T1055.012)
atomic_tests.description:
Create a process in a suspended state, execute shellcode to spawn calc.exe in a child process, and then resume the original process.
This test uses the CreatePipe function to create an anonymous pipe that parent and child processes can communicate over. This anonymous pipe
allows for the retrieval of output generated from executed shellcode.
- PoC Credit: (https://github.com/Ne0nd0g/go-shellcode#createprocesswithpipe)

hollow_binary_path.description: Path of the binary to hollow

hollow_process_name.description: Name of the process to hollow
